title: home visit
body: Today i had a home visit,I did not recognise the GP who attended.It would have been nice to see one of the partners. I explained the problem i had. He  said he would go back to surgery and discuss the problem with a colleague. Then as i know about my illness, He asked me about end of life care. This I had addressed with McMillan nurse 5 months ago. I found the questions unnecessary. and upsetting?

title: Rude staff
body: I went to the cafe for some food then went to reception to ask if they could offer any advice on vaccine clinic dates , woman ignored me for a fair few minutes , then looked up at me as if I was bothering her and said 'what do you want' no smile nothing,  rhen I asked her if she could offer any information and she said 'no' in a rude manner and turned her head away.

readBy.name: South Tyneside and Sunderland NHS Foundation Trust

title: Excellent caring practice
body:
I would like to praise the Doctors and Receptionists on their caring approach to dealing with many health concerns for my elderly Mum Marjorie Spears.
When contacting surgery the receptionists are always empathetic, and very reassuring, and the Doctors have been very good at calling  me to discuss any medical needs for my Mum, in a world where there is so much criticism for the NHS, I would like to congratulate them on their approach care 
Denise Clayton

title: Regret choosing The Rivers
body: I was due to be referred for a specialised scan on 13 January. Three months later I still don't know if I've been referred. This week, 4 April, I ended up in hospital with pain, distended stomach and inability to eat properly due to my liver. It is virtually impossible to get to talk to someone at The Rivers as a NHS patient. The NHS department are there 3 days a week for 4 hours a day and never answer the phone. No one else will speak to you as a NHS patient. I regret the day that I chose this hospital for treatment.

title: Waiting over 4 years for vascular surgery
body: I am still on the wait list for 4 years to have my vascular surgery. If I had the money. I’d go private. This is the worst dept at west middx hospital

readBy.name: Chelsea and Westminster Hospital NHS Foundation Trust

title: Inadequate
body: Lines open at 8.30 am. So if you work Full Time, be prepared to have a stressful day trying to call in if you can manage to prise yourself away from the umpteen jobs you have to do at work. If you work in a school good luck trying to call during break and then lunch because every time I have tried at break time I have been stuck in a queue for the entire duration. If you call at lunch time and get through good luck getting a same day appt. That's not all. Be prepared to exercise patience and do it all again several times in the week because the receptionist will advise you to call back the next day to be in with a chance if getting an appointment on the same day. Absolute joke. Thats not all. The econsult is so random. Often questions are closed and there is no option but to select an inapplicable answer for the sake of progressing onto the  next question. It's worrying that these questions are used to carry out Asthma reviews for instance.

title: Not happy at all
body: Went there for first immunisation of my baby, and wait 20 minutes in same waiting area with ill people. It was explained to me that they are running late and they book 2 people for same time. Shame!

title: Would not go anywhere else
body: Been with this practice for nearly 30years and I can say they have been great with me. Its hard for anyone anywhere to get a GP appointment, but if the doctor thinks its worth a call back then they will ring you. and if like me they think you should see him then they will. Times have changed for us all now. I have moved out of the area but I  still go to this pratice

title: Amazing service and amazing people
body: I feel compelled to leave this review. I spent 6hrs on A and E with a pain in my chest neck and arms. This has been getting worse over the past 3 months with no help from my surgery so I called 111 whom advised to go to A and E. bloods etc were taken rapidly but as I sat waiting to be seen I was observing the high volume of people that were coming to A and E and it truly put into perspective the workload the staff have and the dedication they put in. I must admit having this hospital in Margate is amazing. After the wait I was seen and the doctor was amazing said I should have been looked at weeks ago. In summary I can see why no patient can be given 100% I feel under the circumstances the staff give 200% so from the bottom of my heart well done to the staff and the NHS of the hospital

title: Excellent medical care and kind, compassionate…
body: I was admitted to the Acute Medical Ward at the Northern General following an A&E admission on 4/2/2022. I was extremely well cared for, both in the A&E dept. and on the Ward, and I was treated with kindness by all the staff I encountered. In addition, I noted the care and compassion shown to other patients, many of whom were very seriously ill. I'd like to thank everyone who was on duty that weekend and who helped take care of me.

readBy.name: Healthwatch Sheffield
Sheffield Teaching Hospitals NHS Foundation Trust

title: Very poor service
body:
It is very difficult to get an appointment. Reception staff are unhelpful and rude. There are no offer of emergency appointments. I was told to go to A&E if urgent.
No option neither for a face to face appointment, it has to be assessed by a telephone consultation first. The surgery has a very high turnover of GP.

readBy.name: Imperial College, BSc Humanities, Philosophy & Law (2022)

title: pre-op waiting times
body:
I was booked into BMI Southend for eye surgery under LA and told to arrive at 14.30. I was tpld the procedure would take between 60-90 minutes.
On my arrival there was another patient who had been there since 14.00. Another patient was in the theatre.
I was not taken to theatre until 18.00
There was little or no pre-op preparation except to answer a few questions.
This length of time waiting is unnecessary

title: Delivering an effective service
body:
I have never heavily relied on medical support until covid 19 and cancer struck both at the same time! I have nothing other than praise for each and every staff member at the practice. I was clinically assessed the same day and an urgent  referral made which initiated a huge episode of care. This has meant more reliance on the practice and each time I have needed support, or required a review, it has been face to face when needed or telephone care if appropriate.
 I have heard many complaints about why GP's have not yet reverted to previous ways of working, (pre Covid) however, sometimes new ways of working are more effective and services need to be channelled appropriately. 
My only bugbear, is the jaded and occasionally austere initial approach (and I am aware of the conflict the reception team face) a smile goes a long way to helping us along a difficult journey. I thank you all during this crazy Covid period and ongoingly.

title: Repeat prescriptions
body:
05/04/2022 requested (by  phone) an item of my  regular medication plus an item for my wife.  Was told both would be ready for collection at nominated pharmacy by 07/04/2022.  My item was there when I collected on 08/04/2022 but my wife's was not. 
She phoned the surgery at 12.15pm and was told that one prescription had been signed (mine) but the other (wife's) was still unsigned on the doctor's desk.  The receptionist promised that she would get it sgned by another doctor ready for collection later that afternoon. It had still not been received at the pharmacy on 09/04/2022.  Heaven help patients when telephoned repeat prescriptions are discontinued on 01/05/2022      Pharmacy told us the surgery was unreachable one  afternoon this week for training 
Hopefully all staff including the GP's attended !!!

title: Lack of communication from practice
body: Information given in messages from me are ignored and it is impossible to get through to the surgery by phone. I am housebound and therefore cannot attend the practice in person unless a carer can take me.  This limits the times and dates for appointments but no attempts are made to meet my needs.  I appreciate that the practice is busy but a quick phone call would save everyone's time in the long run, but this never happens.

title: Great service
body: My hearing aid broke. Phoned audiology yesterday, got a appointment today, seen on time (3.30pm) by the extremely friendly and helpful technician, pity names can’t be mentioned. He was great, immediately identified the problem, explained fully, fixed it and asked if I needed more batteries, which otherwise I would have forgotten to ask for. Excellent service from start to finish. Thanks to all.

readBy.name: Mid Yorkshire Hospitals NHS Trust

title: Lucky to have both Pelynt  & Old Bridge Surgeries
body: The doctors, nurses, and reception staff, are all very professional, approachable and understanding,  nothing is too much trouble , wished to let you know you are all  appreciated

readBy.name: Plymouth University, BSc (Hons) Nursing (Adult Health) 2022

title: Great practice
body: Great practice. Friendly staff. Always feel welcome when I go to my appointments. Get seen to quick and on time.

title: Gastroscopy
body:
I was referred here to receive a gastroscopy on the NHS. I am not registered with this practice but it seems like it's a well run surgery.
The staff who enabled my gastroscopy (Living Care) were second to none - professional, caring and efficient. The nurse who assessed me and 'checked me in' was lovely, as were the doctor and nurses in the procedure room. I would have no hesitation in recommending this surgery for anyone undergoing this procedure - you will be well looked after.

title: Terrible Practise
body:
I am desperate to leave this surgery but can not register with any other Doctors. 
This is shocking practise it provides no service I don't think there are any doctors. The NHS is not free all of us who work are paying for this and should be able to have access to a doctor. 
I am lucky and generally have good health if I am ill I have no chance of getting through to make an appointment even for a phone consultation. I will probably have to seek private consultation.
This needs to be thoroughly investigated and  put into special measures before any more patients are put in danger or even lose their lives.

title: 1st Class service
body: Advised to go by my GP late on a Friday evening for a tetanus shot after being bitten by a dog. The service/treatment I received was 1st class. From the person who greeted me at the door, the person who dealt with my X-ray through to the Nurse Practitioner who treated me it was nothing short of excellent. A very professional smooth running unit working so efficiently. NHS should use your unit as a model for the rest of the country. Thankyou for your dedication and care in very difficult circumstances.

title: Awful
body:
After being forced to move surgery due to moving house, this surgery is not great at all. 

Doctors are unhelpful, seem uninterested, talk like they are completely clueless and ask me what I want them to do - aren’t they the doctor!?

They never ring for appointments on time, it will be about 4 hours after the time given! - which will be after I’ve gone to work and cannot pick up the phone. 

Yesterday they didn’t even ring me for my emergency appointment!!! Disgusted!! 

If that was an appt for my child I’d be even more furious! There is just no care in this surgery at all!

title: pre-op waiting times
body:
I was booked into BMI Southend for eye surgery under LA and told to arrive at 14.30. I was tpld the procedure would take between 60-90 minutes.
On my arrival there was another patient who had been there since 14.00. Another patient was in the theatre.
I was not taken to theatre until 18.00
There was little or no pre-op preparation except to answer a few questions.
This length of time waiting is unnecessary

readBy.name: BMI Healthcare Ltd

title: Endoscopy appointment.
body:
I had an appointment with endoscopy 9-4-22 I was nervous about the procedure I even thought about cancelling, I explained this to  the staff who were extremely supportive and reassuring.  
from start to finish everything was explained.    This helped me to relax and the endoscopy went smoothly.   The staff were fantastic I appreciate the extra mile they went to.  Brilliant service from a professional staff.

title: Thank you
body: Dr and staff were absolutely wonderful- made me feel very reassured couldn't of asked for better treatment.

title: Poor and unprofessional
body: I’ve been promised discharge for my wife who’s given a birth day before . Midwife approved discharge at 1 pm and she will do paperwork and we wait 6 hours for paperwork . Very unpleasant experience, staff working like snail speed and NHS still want more money ? For what ? That’s unbelievable and to stay in the room hungry, thirsty and not even apologize it is a shame . They was just laughing in a “staff room “ and nothing more . Shame

readBy.name: London North West University Healthcare NHS Trust

title: Very judgmental staff & no compassion
body:
Arrived today at the centre to be told that my carer couldn’t attend the appointment with me. I explained I have mental health issues and she said no, nothings on your notes. Why would I lie about having a disability? So they had to wait outside. Considering it’s already a very overwhelming appointment I think the receptionist lacked compassion and understanding & didn’t seem to have any medical training on disabilities. 
Secondly the nurse I saw was very patronising and talking down to me like I had no understanding of contraception. She came across very judgmental and pushy. I felt like crying when I came out of the clinic.

title: Excellent intervention
body: 2 speedy and incredibly thorough interventions in the past couple of months for my family. One lead to a timely referral to a hospital consultant for further investigations. The other allowed commencement of appropriate treatment for my son by the end of the day following completion of an econsult. Very efficient and reassuring service when it was needed.

title: Aggressive and rude nurse at this facility
body:
I attended Hunter Street Health centre yesterday for a GP requested blood test at 4pm. At reception, I was given six forms submitted by my GP for a variety of tests and I am in need to keep a record of these.
 
The nurse that saw me was quite rude and intimidating, her tone was aggressive and impatient. Normally I have very positive interactions with the nurses that take my blood tests but this changed dramatically as this nurse does not make it easy for people that are struggling with health issues. Her customer service skills and tone were very disappointing.
 
The last time I attended this service I was allowed to take a photo of the forms for my records so that I know what tests are being conducted which is very important for me. But this nurse objected to it and was very blunt and dismissive about it. I had to solve my predicament on my own by returning to reception and ask them to print off the forms again for me which they happily did and I believe they were surprised at the nurse’s attitude. It was a waste of paper.
 
 I am sure I will be referred for tests again and will refuse to be seen by this woman ever again. I think it is important for her to be spoken to as she really should not treat patients this way.

readBy.name: Camden and Islington NHS Foundation Trust

title: Kind service
body: Went in with a hand injury and the staff were so kind especially when I nearly fainted! I was in and out in an hour and given plenty of advice to change dressing and care for it. Thank you

title: Great service
body: Can always get an on the appointment when needed which is great having 2 young children.  Receptionist have always been friendly and helpful and the nurse giving my babies injections has always been great with my baby and even better at putting me at ease….lovely surgery

title: Appalling lack of Care
body:
Arrived at A&E at 6pm with acute back pain and unable to walk.Admitted to waiting room on ward at 1am.. Had a bed at 3am..Had been sitting with horrendous pain in a hard chair for 9 hrs, no offer of pain relief or water. Complete lack of concern from any staff. Left in bed unable to get to the bathroom  no offer of help or means to wash.
Cleaner on ward used same cloth to clean bathroom bins and tables beside beds.Dusted over our heads knocking dust onto our heads and beds.
Mo nursing care at all .A really terrible experience.

readBy.name: Great Western Hospitals NHS Foundation Trust

title: Execptional service
body: Walked in very friendly receptionist booked in sat down was told it would be about an hour if id like to come back so i said id wait in the car and they said they'd ring if they could get me in sooner 20 minutes later id been seen and was on my way great professional service

readBy.name: Derbyshire Community Health Services NHS Foundation Trust

title: Great friendly service
body:
Friendly attentive informative gAve me excersizes to do for relief ...... Advised if any more problems to ring direct.
Wrist splint being given for night relief

title: Work GP
body: Don’t bother going there, the worst GP ever. Been trying to book an appointment for over a year about a pain in my leg & always get brushed off. On top of that they are so rude & not understanding. Will definitely be changing GP soon.

title: Poor experience
body: I cant say i was happy. With a spine infection there were no chair to protect my neck. Huge wating time and a 90+ min wait jusy to hear when orthopedic dept thought, who didnt even see me. Gone home after 6 hours in more pain than when i arrived

title: Great hospital
body: Terrific hospital very clean and the staff from nurses and Physcio’s to the cleaners were all brilliant would definitely recommend this hospital to anyone had a stroke and they looked after me wonderfully during a very frightening time in my life

title: Broken rib
body:
I was taken to AnE in the evening with a suspected broken rib. The ambulance gave me entonox forvthe pain.
As i got to AnE. My details were taken. The staff in the most part were good.
I was taken straight away for an xray.
This came back as i was told as not being broken..i was given some pain relief that didnt agree with me as i told the nurse. But was offered nothing else...this was about 12.30 am
I was usshered into a room and left dor about 6 hrs..
In that time i watched the doctor who eventuall saw me and gave me the same pain relief i had just refused..
During the course of the morning this doctor was in and out of the dept in no seeming rush...
Once it was understood my rib was not broken. They could have sent me home as nothing can be done...
But no i was left for 6 hrs....
One other patient walked out as hecwas left as i was..
I know AnE is a busy place but dumping people unecessarily in a room did not help.
From the xray to seeing the doctor not one person checked on me.
Marks out of 10 for service.   4
I cant speak for staff.  There was a lot of socialising with ambulance crew.  
Overall rating out of 10.    4

readBy.name: Milton Keynes University Hospital NHS Foundation Trust

title: Outstanding practice
body:
I moved to the area a few years ago and was expecting a my child, therefore I had to change my practice to alpine surgery and was the best move I ever made. 
I want to say a huge Thankyou to all of the team weather you helped me with my pregnancy, answered my phone calls when I needed you the most or dealing with my mental health, you all need a medal!
You see and deal with thousands of patients everyday with all kinds of needs,  you would probably have listened to repeated needs but you never shown inpatient to any of my problems, you never tried to shorten my calls like we were a number. 
In December 2020 I went through such a hard time in my life along with many others and this is when I needed the practice the most. I can’t describe how you all were with me other than you saved my life… you gave me purpose to live. I have never experienced such great care in all my life. 
I call up today with another concern and I was remembered after talking and listening to me. 
Everyone in that practice deserves an applause and a massive well done not to mention that this all went on through the Covid pandemic. 
P.s my son can not wait to get his next jabs done by the nurses just so he can have a sticker and a chocolate (ssshhhhhhhhhhh) it’s all about the little things in life :) 

I really hope on Monday morning you start the week by gathering together in your briefing or whatever your usual routine is and this review gets read out to you all. We all dread that Monday morning and negative thoughts so I hope this starts your day with a smile. You are noticed just like you noticed me :)

title: Amu not answering
body: Staff do not answer phone just cut me off husband had a stroke can’t find out anything not allowed to visit how do l no what is happening to him

readBy.name: Frimley Health NHS Foundation Trust
Healthwatch Surrey

title: Waiting time is a joke
body: Went to the hospital by ambulance with 2 year old at 8pm still waiting to be seen it's now 1.30am. how can leaving little children that long to be seen. It's a disgrace

readBy.name: East Sussex Healthcare NHS Trust

title: Best hospital ever
body: I really disagree with other silly reviews concerning SPIRE HOSPITAL. All staff and especially anethatist and surgeon we second to none. They were very caring bedside manner was tops made me feel very comfortable, good job we have people in this profession like this. Thankyou so much I’m very grateful for all spire has done for me. I’ve now got my life back to normal.

title: Would not help me with a strongest pain
body:
I came with a strong neuralgia , could not move , strong constant pain .
They made me wait for more then an hour and when in tears I asked them to see doctor faster they said it’s a line and I must wait . I thought emergency ward is suppose to help them . Specially that I told them in tears that I am in strong pain .
And I have member care of that hospital too .
I had to leave without any help .
Will never visit it again for sure .
Horrible horrible service

readBy.name: University Hospitals of Leicester NHS Trust

title: Poor service - cancelled at time of attending
body:
Failed to advice only found out when attended appointment. No correspondence before, how hard to contact before and advice.
Staff unhappy more interested in there child at work that doing a job.

title: Good practice
body: Normally I’m happy with outcome over the phone or face to face. But yesterday I had a phone consultation and I have to say I’m really disappointed. I was awaiting what I believe an important call from the doctor but when talking to him he didn’t seem to know anything that had been going on. He gave me my blood results but should have known why I had so many done and of other tests that I have had. I put the phone down with less confidence in them than I would normally have had. He was also unaware of a letter sent by the Hubb so I’m afraid normally they are good which is why I have put down good and would normally recommend but not this time.

title: Very kind staff
body: I called concerned amd the receptionist & GP who later called me were both so kind. I received a text from the GP the following day checking I had heard about my scan & seeing how I was feeling. Given the current pressure that general practice is under I was really touched by the time & compassion shown by the staff - thank you, it made a big difference to how I felt at such a scary time.

title: New Hathern Pharmacy
body: We now have a brilliant new method of obtaining prescriptions at Hathern. Instead of having to go into the Pharmacy, with it's nice warm centrally heated interior, which must greatly increase all those nasty germs and bugs, we can wait outside and receive our prescriptions through a hole in the wall. No more worrying about catching some nasty illness from all those germs floating around inside, we are protected in the fresh air. All right, it may be freezing cold, a gale force wind almost blowing us over, pouring with rain, hail or snow, we are save outside waiting patiently for our prescription to be found and delivered safely through the hole in the wall. Another patient led approach from this practice.

title: Excellent professional service
body: I naturally went in for my operation anxious and worried, I need not have worried. From the friendly porter taking me to my room. The treatment I got was the best practice I have ever had. So from the orthopaedic surgeon, anaesthetic consult, sister who looked after me from a nursing perspective, pre assessment staff, housekeeping , physio, theatre and recovery staff.To all the members of staff at The Lancaster Hospital Meadowside. Thank you so much for your care and attention. So 5 stars. Thanks again.

readBy.name: BMI Healthcare Ltd

title: Great hospital and great staff
body: I have been a patient for more than 25 years at this superb hospital. My recent experiences mirror those of many excursions into various departments, clinicians, nurses and technical staff. All helpful and professional and especially at this time of severe strain on services. I pay particular tribute to the renal department well led and motivated and I recently contracted covid the care at all the dialysis centres(QA, Havant and Totton has been attentive even brilliant! A word also about hospital patient transport which is under pressure, but the staff there have gone over and beyond the call of duty. Well done all of you.

title: More than medicine!
body: Your Review:  I saw a nurse today in a lovely pink room!!  and she is an angel. She made me feel like I was her only patient and nothing was any trouble. She allowed me to talk about things I didn’t have an appointment for. She really listened and gave me the most needed hug when I got upset! She helped me more that she will ever know, not all problems need pills. I left feeling so much better about things after talking it through with her, thankyou, I’m so grateful x

readBy.name: Imperial College, BSc Humanities, Philosophy & Law (2022)

title: Great help
body: When I come for my appoitment doctor was very frendly ,and me was happy,I given me many advice,he talk slowly that was many help

title: Exemplary experience
body: I would recommend the orthopaedic &Spine hospital to anyone. The treatment l received when attending for knee arthroscopy was exemplary. The staff were friendly and efficient . The internal surroundings were relaxing and spotless.

title: Would not help me with a strongest pain
body:
I came with a strong neuralgia , could not move , strong constant pain .
They made me wait for more then an hour and when in tears I asked them to see doctor faster they said it’s a line and I must wait . I thought emergency ward is suppose to help them . Specially that I told them in tears that I am in strong pain .
And I have member care of that hospital too .
I had to leave without any help .
Will never visit it again for sure .
Horrible horrible service

readBy.name: University Hospitals of Leicester NHS Trust

title: Wonderful care,treatment and help
body: I had a very positive experience from the wonderful staff on every level. Fantastic care and help. All staff were helpful and kind despite being understaffed and busy. The Physiotherapy and Occupational Therapy team were paticularly helpful, their help gave me the tools to help myself an gave me great hope to move forward.

readBy.name: University Hospitals Birmingham NHS Foundation Trust

title: Fantastic, compassionate care
body:
I attended the department following an urgent referral. I was seen promptly and received brilliant care. All the staff I met were compassionate, caring, responsive and clearly very knowledgeable. The department was well organised, clean and staff worked well together to make me feel safe and looked after. 

Attending hospital for treatment can be very anxiety provoking but the staff made me feel comfortable and calm, both before and throughout the procedure. Afterwards, I was given advice on what to do at home and how to seek further help and treatment. I was provided with a discharge letter and medication. Excellent care, thank you.

readBy.name: University Hospitals of Leicester NHS Trust

title: Excellent Practice
body:
This surgery is 10/10. You can always get through to a friendly receptionist and you do not have to wait long for a doctors appointment. 
Whether I am attending for my own health needs or for my childrens, the Doctor is welcoming, understanding and reassuring 
I would recommend this practice to anybody who wishes to receive excellent health care.

title: Fabulous staff
body: Called 111 and was asked to attend the Fanshawe wing this Sunday morning. Yes they were busy and there was a bit of a wait but that is totally understandable under the current circumstances. That said every contact I had with a member of staff was positive, from reception, to triage, to analysis. Bravo RSH to you and your fabulous staff.

title: Caring and dedicated staff
body:
I had a day case operation yesterday. From the moment I arrived at the ward I was put straight at ease. I was lucky enough to be placed in the bed next to a woman I met on the way to the ward and we chatted away all day. Theatre staff were pleasant and reassuring, despite working through their breaks to get as many ops done as possible. Unfortunately two ladies on our bank of beds were rescheduled which was devastating for them but difficult choices seem to be the way things are running in the NHS. 

Back on the ward I was greeted with a lovely hot chocolate and my special request egg sandwich… Ward staff were working hard tending to all the individual needs, getting us all mobile. Their attention to detail goes a long way to making the patient experience a far less traumatic one. Big thanks to all the team who treated me… I feel a million dollars today! Ward F Ormskirk Hospital rocks!!

title: Mixed experiences
body:
Receptionists polite, friendly and helpful. Always seem to provide an appointment if needed, and alright amount of availability if booking in advance. 
Nurses and health care assistants always friendly,  and good at putting patients at ease.
GP more variable. Have had some good experiences, but have also had experience of being treated with utter disdain by the same GP. Most people go to GP if worried about something.  To continuously have every effort to speak shut down, complete refusal to engage in a conversation, is demoralising at best. To be sent away feeling utterly hopeless at an incredibly difficult time because a GP has chosen to not offer any reassurance because they  were not open minded enough to look into a patients problem, to show no care or compassion is incredibly detrimental.

title: Almost impossibe to get through via telephone
body: Phone system requires urgent review.  It took 3 days of being 'persistent' to get through and then told to ring back at 8.00am the following day for an appointment.  It took a further 2 days to succeed.  No pre-bookable appointments with GP.  In comparison with other surgeries, the call answering system is just not efficent, and as well as being stressful for the staff who have to take the calls from disgruntled patients,  I suspect many patients end up in A&E due to deterioating symptoms that could have been avoided had they been able to access GP services earlier.  Come on LS, you could do so much better!  Excellent service once an appointment is in place, it's just trying to get one that is the issue.

title: Uncaring
body: I would have given the rating 5 out of 5 if I was rating the doctor and some of the nurses. One of the nurses I felt were uncaring and should choose a different profession. Once I was treated with a saline drip and given the tests I needed I was told I could go as my stats had improved. I was also asked to provide a feces sample by the doctor. I did this, told 2 different nurses and it was still in the bathroom when I left. So still not sure if this was tested. I asked one nurse which way the main entrance was too which she said very curtly where it says way out. I was feeling very unsteady on my feet as  I had lost a lot of fluids and I had a knee replacement a few weeks earlier.  Due to her attitude I felt I was unable to ask for help.  By the time I got to the main entrance I felt as if I was going to pass out.

readBy.name: Northumbria Healthcare NHS Foundation Trust
St. Andrews University ScotGEM Medical Students

author: Eddieb100
title: My caring nurses
body: The two nurses, Danielle and Katie at Nuffield Hospital in Taunton were amazing! Made me feel very welcome and at ease pre and post surgery. It was a repeat surgery and my experience was ten fold better at Nuffield than it was previously

title: Appalling management
body: After a fall resulting in, according to the Walk in centre, cracked ribs on Monday, I am struggling with the pain and was trying to speak to a clinician about further pain relief. After the prolonged recorded message I was informed  they weren't  taking  calls and was cut off. I've heard  that once they reach 40 people this happens;that is just 10 calls per Practice- not good enough. I rang 111 who were very helpful and sent a request for me to be rung by a gp. That was this morning and it's now 8.30pm and I've heard nothing. Once you get through to a clinician  they are great but the management,  admin and receptionist system is atrocious; some of them are downright rude.  When it was Malago it was a brilliant  practice  but ever since BVM was formed- which pre dates covid so that cant  be blamed, they have  gone rapidly downhill.  I'm stuck now with another night of pain. Absolutely awful

author: Girdf55
title: Only one hour a day allowed with a dying relative
body:
I had travelled down to Scotland to visit my dying father in Southampton general hospital.  
I was only allowed one hour a day to see my father which I was very grateful for, but seems very unkind to only allow such little time for my father and family especially when I know other hospitals allow families to visit longer when their loved ones are at end of life.  
I phoned this evening to plead with the charge nurse to allow me to see my father outwith this one hour but she was having none of it and very unsympathetic towards us.  
Surely this hospital needs to follow suit with other hospitals and allow families to visit more so that their dying husband and parent does not die feeling alone? I felt very upset and disappointed by this today. Other staff members have been very kind and accommodating and my family will appreciate their kindness.

readBy.name: University Hospital Southampton NHS Foundation Trust

author: Baxbon
title: Lack of care, empathy and general bedside manner
body:
A bit of background - I'm currently seeing a community mental health nurse, dealing with depression & anxiety brought on because of my pain levels.  
In February I had a phone appointment with a pain doctor. I felt patronised, pathetic, worthless to be honest.  
To be told there is no more treatment medication or otherwise - and it should be dealt with through self-management like mindfulness, pacing etc. - because they don't have a magic wand. I do mindfulness every day, understand and practice pacing.  
However, because I'm seeing a CPN the pain doctor says I don't have the capacity to do this. I got very upset, to the point I couldn't speak. I said goodbye and ended the call.  
30 minutes later my CPN called to check in, apparently the doctor had emailed to say I'd gotten upset. Well what did they expect?  
To add, before I was ill I worked in the health service. There was another health professional on the line who I wasn’t introduced to - I feel this could be a breach of data protection”

readBy.name: NHS Ayrshire & Arran
Imperial College, BSc Humanities, Philosophy & Law (2022)
East Ayrshire Advocacy Services
Scottish Recovery Network
NHS Education for Scotland

author: Daisychain2
title: Good care throughout labour and afterwards
body:
I went in for my induction at the end of March. I was able to get an outpatient induction which was explained fully to me and I was really pleased to be able to get home. All staff on induction ward were very busy but always so kind and kept me up to date with when a bed would be ready for me on labour ward.  
I went to labour ward a few days later at 1:30am. Each of my midwives were fantastic, Jasmine at night and Jillian during the day. I also had a lovely student Megan. I was kept informed about everything that happened and given choices for my care.  
My baby went into distress and the midwives kept me calm and were so professional. The sister introduced herself and was present throughout the day as well. All medical staff were friendly and spent time with me explaining my options and what was best for me and my baby.  
Although my labour was nothing like I planned I still felt in control and my daughter arrived safely. The maternity ward was busy but I received good support from staff with my breastfeeding.  
Despite the pressures the service is under and staffing issues I received really good care throughout and wanted to say thank you to all staff involved.

readBy.name: South Eastern Health and Social Care Trust

author: Aoiyf36
authorRole: a staff member posting for a patient/service user
title: Excellent care after elbow fracture
body:
How I ended up in the Orthopaedics ward is because I fell off my bicycle resulting in me having concussion, and an open fracture to my elbow.  
The care so far has been absolutely excellent. Craigavon Area Hospital has been amazing from the receptionist, porters, nurses, radiographers and doctors were all very professional friendly and caring.  
I was transferred by ambulance to CAH ED department. I was in there for quite a while but it was extremely busy. The staff here continued the high standards of care and nothing was too much trouble. I witnessed compassion and care given to an elderly patient who joined our ward.  
I have underwent surgery to my elbow and now I am in recovery mode and I am enjoying it as the staff have been very pleasant.  
I would like to thank all the staff here in Craigavon who helped me - you were brilliant!

readBy.name: Southern Health and Social Care Trust

author: Starbaby2022
title: Wonderful staff at EPAS Wishaw
body:
After learning the devastating news that I’d had a missed miscarriage, the EPAS staff at Wishaw went above and beyond to look after me. I was able to have my first choice of treatment (MVA) just a few days later.  
Throughout my phone calls, scans and surgery, every member of staff was so compassionate and caring. They took the time to explain everything to me and sat with me while I cried. They listened to my story, even though it wasn’t medically relevant.  
The midwife present during my surgery held my hand and kept me talking throughout the procedure and the doctor and student doctors told me exactly what was happening and helped me through it all. As horrible as the situation was, the surgery was actually a very positive experience and has given me closure on the pregnancy and helped me move forward.  
My only complaint, which is not the fault of the staff, is that the EPAS is only open Monday-Friday. I learned about my missed miscarriage on a Saturday morning and I had a very fraught and anxious 48 hours without knowing my options before I could speak to anyone on the phone.  
Thanks again, especially to midwife Michelle and doctor Laura. You made the hardest point in my life that little bit easier.

readBy.name: NHS Lanarkshire

title: Made me feel at ease
body: Had follow up appointment a 3b tear from childbirth. The appointment involved an examination and some personal topics. I was made to feel very much at ease the whole time. The staff were checking how I felt at all times and have multiple opportunities for me to ask questions.

title: Appointment went well
body: Large site, numerous offices didn't know where to go exactly, there was no building number, so we drove around for a while trying to find the mobile unit. The doctor explained everything and the appointment went well on the day

title: Amazing service
body: After waiting many months for any update on my daughters CAMHS referral, I called to get some advice from my GP. We were seen same day and given amazing care and time from our doctor.

readBy.name: Leeds Healthwatch

title: They’re trying best
body: They are trying their best possible for patients. I call today and got an appointment however we are waiting to see the doctor face to face would be great. We met lovely lady over the phone call assisted me in a very nice way. Great

title: Great practice, excellent service and doctors
body: The system of ask my GP is great, quick response. Appointment is easy and quick if needed.I was with the surgery for 16 years . I have a lot of medical problems . The doctors looking after me, excellent care , very good treatment , referral to hospitals if needed. Investigation as blood is done at the surgery. I would like to thank the doctors for their care.

title: Detailed review by GP
body: The GP I met was really great and done a detailed review giving all details/ actions with next steps. Really appreciated and continuing my checkups with him.

title: Excellent Care
body:
I was recently admitted for a day procedure in the sandbourne ward where I would be put under general anaesthetic. Every staff member was extremely friendly and put me at ease throughout my time there. I was a little anxious but the quality of care definitely made me feel better. It was also on a Saturday so I really appreciate the staff working overtime at the weekend.
The doctor and anaesthetist were very clear and concise while every nurse was very caring, chatty and also had a joke with me.
The personal care really made a difference and turned a daunting trip to hospital into a much better experience. Thanks for looking after me.

readBy.name: University Hospitals Dorset NHS Foundation Trust

title: Great Practice
body:
Cataracts
First Eye 
Second Eye
All want well with each eye appointment procedure. It's like a miracle.
Everything is in detail and  brighter. 
Wonderful

title: Fantastic
body:
I was in and out of Gravesend community hospital Urgent Treatment Centre on Bath St within one hour, I had triage and saw the doctor and came away with a golden ticket of a prescription. I got the medication from a late chemist and then got back to full health.

The Doctor was amazing - full of empathy and gave a detailed description which was very helpful for me. She really cared for me and was superb from start to finish. 

This was a qualty experience compared to visiting another hospital with the same issue and waiting 4 hours and not seeing anyone at all.

readBy.name: Kent Community Health NHS Foundation Trust

title: Poor booking system and unhelpful GPs
body:
The booking system needs rethinking. You need to ring first thing at 8am, sit through a queue of about 40 people, wait an hour typically, then get put through to the reception. The GP then calls you later at a random time in the day, so you better not miss the call! You will have no idea when it is coming. Once the appointments are gone, there is nothing you can do about it. You just have to try again tomorrow. You cannot book a day in advance. The online booking system is currently disabled.

I had to do a blood test and the person at reception only gave me half the paper work with the majority of the tests to be taken missing. I had to ring up to ask what had happened and why I had not received any results. It took them several days to sort the issue and now I have to do the tests all over again.

The GP I spoke to would not let me get a word in edgeways. I am not sure how they expect to make accurate diagnoses when they are not listening to the patients problems and talking over them. I have been suffering from persistent migraines and did not even get the chance to share this.

This is a shame because some GPs at the surgery are actually incredibly helpful, explain things clearly and really take the time to listen to you. You just never know which one you are going to get!

title: Category one call: Ambulance never sent: A&E quiet
body: My daughter cut her wrist to bone depth (ultimately requiring 11 stitches) in the early morning. She was bleeding badly. We were told an ambulance would be dispatched. We are 10 minutes from the BRI and the Ambulance station. I held the wound closed for 60 minutes. We rang 999 again and were told that a unit had not been sent and was unlikely to be sent in the next hour. We took her to the BRI. At the BRI, two ambulances were parked empty, being slowly re-equipped by a one person. The A&E waiting room was empty. Nurses staff took my daughter immediately in to the clinical area. I moved my car, noting the ambulances were still there. Why were we allowed to wait an hour without being contacted about the lack of ambulance?

readBy.name: South Western Ambulance Service NHS Foundation Trust

title: Good care
body:
I just want to thank everyone who looked after my mum who is 93, she tested positive for covid on Wednesday and on Thursday suffered a fall at home.
Although my mum waited hours in an ambulance, due to no beds available, she was treated with dedicated care from the ambulance men and all A and A staff not forgetting her short staff in EAU 
Thank you

readBy.name: University Hospitals of Leicester NHS Trust

title: Not a walk in urgent care service
body: The NHS website directs you to use this urgent care service instead of A&E for certain conditions. However, on arrival my grandmother was turned away to treat her wound as she did not have a pre-booked appointment. This is not clear on any of the websites and meant a wasted journey for an elderly person needing urgent treatment. Staff were helpful in arranging transport to A&E where the wound was treated instead.

title: Great Health care assistance
body:
Me and my family would like to say big thank you to all HCA for all support given to us in the past years. 
My sister especially would like to say thank you to the wonderful HCA “A”for all mental support for last month. You are just amazing people and we are very grateful!

title: Kind and caring
body: Without exception staff were kind and knowledgeable. At each point, everything was explained carefully, well and with empathy.

title: Kind and caring
body: Without exception staff were kind and knowledgeable. At each point, everything was explained carefully, well and with empathy.

title: Terrible Service
body:
I have been a patient at this practice for years and I am appalled by the service provided. I have consistently been trying to ring at 8:15 for an appointment however the phone line is always busy and cuts off. I have tried for 3 days now with no luck. I tried again around 1pm (outside the busy phone times as stated by the practice) but still the phone line is busy. It is not an issue with my phone as when I ring prior to 8:15 my call goes through with the automated message saying phone lines open at 8:15.

There is an option for either an online consultation or to book an appointment online on the website but this never seems to be working and instead the practice prefers for everyone to ring at one time and take up all the phone lines. Wouldn't a practice try to have less people ringing and make use of the online service? It is ridiculous. 111 online refers me back to ringing a GP but how can I do that when I can't even get through in the first place.

Major improvements need to be made for the patient service as it seems like no one is bothered. Just scroll through the most recent reviews and you will see just how difficult it is trying to get a hold of anyone at this practice. Totally agree with all the 1 star reviews everyone has been posting. The generic answers are just copied and pasted back as a response to each review but no changes have been made to anything. It is clear that patients and their wellbeing are not at the forefront of this practice.

After numerous attempts to get in touch with the GP practice I finally managed to speak to a receptionist yesterday (29 Mar 22) at midday after being on hold for approx an hour. After explaining my symptoms I was told there were no more appoints available and to try again tomorrow. I was made aware e-consulatation is available every morning 8-8:15 and phone lines open at 8:15 so I can try either option. I was also told to keep ringing back because its normal for the phone lines to say they're busy and cut off.

Throughout the day my symptoms worsened so I rang 111 at approx 1pm  and they referred me back to my GP for a telephone consultation. This appointment appeared on my Airmid app so I was satisfied I would be contacted. Surprisingly I was not contacted and the appointment disappeared from my app. This is shocking behaviour. Especially if highly vulnerable kr elderly people required your services and were referred by 111.

30 Mar 22 I took the receptionists advice and tried e-consulatation at 8am. I got through all the questions only to be told I would need to speak to someone. So at 8:15  I began calling the GP. I rang 200 times and didn't get through once.  I don't have that much free time to sit around and try making an appointment. It's hard to fit in with a working day.

readBy.name: Healthwatch Bradford

title: Thoughtfulness, kindness and respect
body: My father came to the SAU ward for a simple procedure that turned into the end of his life. Whilst the staff never 'met' him fully conscious, they looked after him with respect and care as he died, continuing to moisturise his skin, cleaning his mouth, changing his gown etc with empathy. They looked after us too over the days and night we stayed with him giving us pillows, blankets and tea. Plus a really kind handwriten card when we all left!  So very appreciated, thankyou you lovely people for making that hard time better.

readBy.name: Royal United Hospital Bath NHS Trust

title: Just wonderful
body:
I just wanted to thank everyone in the maternity unit. Especially the central delivery suite. 

Our baby was born yesterday and you were just all so wonderful. Especially the midwife who stayed with us all through the night and was just wonderful and all the doctors and people who helped deliver her. I can’t thank you enough. You are the very best of us and your kindness and energy is incredible. 

Please keep doing what you’re doing in what must be incredibly hard circumstances. My words can never repay your kindness, but if it brings a smile to your face that’s at least something. 

Thank you again.

readBy.name: University Hospitals Dorset NHS Foundation Trust

title: Very good care
body:
The long wait on phone to get an appointment is more than made up for by the quality of care received.  The doctor I spoke to was very good. 
She referred me to have a number of tests which were arranged quickly and follow up treatment at the practice was also very prompt and efficient.

author: 72gump
title: Felt safe and secure in oral & maxillofacial surgery
body:
I attended the reception at the appointed time and was invited into the surgery almost immediately by the nursing team.  
The surgeon was Mr Honey and his team. I was reassured at all stages of the procedure and the was a nice and friendly atmosphere. I felt safe and secure that at any time I felt I could signal them for a rest.  
Top marks for the relaxed atmosphere yet still very professional.

readBy.name: Royal Devon University Healthcare NHS Foundation Trust

title: Fabulous receptionists
body: They work together as a team very professional and do all they can for patients. Very accommodating

author: Treez
title: Everyone deserves to be treated with respect and dignity
body:
I was admitted as an Emergency to Craigavon Area Hospital A&E dept via ambulance. I was given medication for suspected heart attack in the Ambulance. The Ambulance service was excellent and a thorough report was written up containing my medical information to handover. This included information of my previous airway surgery in September 2021, during which I had had a cardiac arrest and received CPR.  
I was tested for COVID and bloods were taken and an ECG and then I was wheeled in a chair and left in the corridor opposite the main entrance doors. Despite several requests for pain relief I was not given anything until 4+hrs after admission. I had suffered a functional nonepeleptic attack which resulted in me falling of the chair onto the ground. This was most likely triggered by pain and sitting in a cold doorway for over 4hrs. I couldn’t get up off the floor myself as I have no control over My limbs when this happens. One of the Nurses was very rude and insisted that if I was able to get myself off the chair then I could get myself back on it again. A hoist was sent for but it took 3 to 4 attempts to get me into it as it seemed the staff hadn't been trained in its use. I was then put back onto the chair and ignored. I was still in pain and this was worse since they’d rolled me in and out of the hoist.I asked a cleaner to ask one of the nurses for pain relief. A nurse came out and took my blood pressure and went and got me Paracetamol. The staff member that had been rude earlier then came out and I asked how much longer I’d have to wait to be seen. The reply was that at the start of their shift there had been an 8 hour backlog, so I could work the rest out for myself. I had been waiting over 4hrs and by these calculations it would be at least another 4 hrs before I would be seen. It was already the early hours of the morning, I was tired, in pain, cold, and didn’t feel safe, especially because of the way I was treated earlier. I said well then I am going home.. to which they replied that this was my choice. They then pulled my bag from behind the chair, that the ambulance crew had said to pack. My husband arrived later and stood at the door of the treatment room but then had to go in as nobody came out. He told them he was here to take me home. They said that given the seriousness of your my condition, they would strongly advise waiting to be seen by a Doctor. My husband replied that I'd be better off at home and we will speak to the GP in the morning.  
The next morning my daughter rang to find out the results of my blood tests and was told as I hadn't stayed to be seen, we couldn't get the results, and that they will be sent on to the GP.  
My daughter rang the GP and they said they hospital should have given the results to me. I was able to get a review appointment with My ENT consultant the next day ,who was able to see the results and confirm that they had been alright. The most likely cause of the severe chest pain was from subluxation of my ribs and bruising from the CPR. I have hypermobile joints and they hadn’t broken but had moved.  
I know A&E departments are under pressure but there was no excuse in My opinion for the total lack of care I received. Everyone deserves to be treated with respect and dignity..things need to change.

readBy.name: Southern Health and Social Care Trust
Ulster University, MBBS (Medicine) 2021
Northern Ireland ambulance service
Public Health Agency

author: Upset2022
title: Poor GP service
body:
My husband was seen by the doctor at Larne Health Centre regarding his worsening back pain. He very infrequently goes to see GP and was told his back pain is due to being overweight and was advised to lose 2 5kg. No advice given on how to do this, no time frame, no referrals made and no advice on how to manage pain in the mean time.  
My husband feels his pain was dismissed and is now reluctant to contact GPs. Poor practice, seems like the doctor went for the simplest answer without investigating cause. Also shocked that BMI was used as this is a known flawed tool and doesn't take in to account things such as muscle mass or bone density. So dismissive and my husband is still in pain and now self conscious regarding weight.

readBy.name: Ulster University, MBBS (Medicine) 2021

author: maygy66
title: Concerns over dislocated thumb treatment
body:
I fell over at Dunster Castle four days ago, and dislocated my thumb joint. I went directly to Minehead Minor injuries unit for treatment and my joint was x-rayed and successfully put back into place.  
Afterwards, a nurse ‘splinted’ the joint by wrapping it in Elastoplast. Unfortunately I am - as it turns out - very allergic to Elastoplast. I removed the Elastoplast the next day when I noticed a reaction developing but I now have a very severe skin issue which will probably take a number of weeks to resolve.  
When I got to Cornwall on the next leg of my holiday, I phoned 111 and was directed to St Austell minor injuries where I was offered a choice of two types of splinted glove, or have the joint in plaster. The health professional who dealt with me there said that using Elastoplast for a dislocation was a very old fashioned way to deal with that type of injury.  
I’m wondering why I wasn’t offered a splinted gloved at Minehead? It would’ve been so much better.

readBy.name: Somerset NHS Foundation Trust
Cornwall Partnership NHS Foundation Trust

author: BillyC
title: A truly great service
body:
I took unwell driving into Glasgow with my family. I collapsed and became unconscious near Glasgow Royal Infirmary.  
GRI A&E Staff were first class and immediately admitted me into hospital. I was given a thorough check by Doctor Cahill, a lovely, kind and compassionate young man and his attending team.  
I was admitted to Ward 11 where the attention to detail was second to none. _All_ staff were attentive, caring and compassionate, sometimes under extreme duress and provocation. I was looked after by them at all times including auxiliary staff, nursing staff and their many proficient doctors.  
I was given thorough examinations to try and determine my prognosis, i.e. blood clots; CT Scans etc etc.  
I would like to thank _all _staff in A&E and Ward 11 who provided an excellent and professional first class service - If this is the standard we have in busy and extremely volatile wards then OUR NHS Scotland services are in good hands.

readBy.name: NHS Greater Glasgow & Clyde
Partnership for Change

author: loz83
title: Bad experience
body:
I take unwell frequently as I am immunocomprimised so the slightest thing ends up making me really unwell.  
I always end up at my local hospital the Queen Elizabeth University Hospital Glasgow where as much as they are busy etc they are amazing.  
The last time the hospital was on divert so I was sent to A & E and then to the Acute Medical Unit at the Royal Alexandra Hospital in Paisley. It was literally an awful experience.  
I was told on numerous occasions I should be in a single room but was put on a ward and I was promised everyone was properly tested for Covid before going on the ward (they came in the next day to test people they a had forgotten to test), the ward was also mixed with men and women which I thought was inappropriate as well.  
I was told my curtain could be kept closed to protect me but there was still the problem of a shared bathroom but no other options were offered to me.  
Prior to discharge my nurse had told me a taxi would be arranged to take me home as it was outwith my area but the discharge team were not told about this. When they called the ward they were told to show me to the bus stop.  
Now with no immune system I should not be on a bus, I am recovering from Covid & had another infection which led me to being in the hospital to advise showing me to a bus stop I thought was really inappropriate. Especially as it was going to be 5 different buses over a course of 3 hours to get me home when unwell.  
A taxi firm from my local area quoted me £40 in a taxi home but nobody could help me locate a cash machine I just kept getting asked if I was sure no one could collect me (husband does not drive and our family are at the other side of the country)  
I understand the NHS is stretched and things can't always run smoothly but please consider when closing hospitals & diverting people to areas they do not know that a bit of help of guidance to getting home is all that is needed.  
I am now petrified of falling unwell again at any point & getting taken out of my own area again which is worrying as well

readBy.name: NHS Greater Glasgow & Clyde

title: Really helpful
body: I've only recently joined the practice having been removed by my previous GP of 23yrs following a move.  I have had to use the surgery more frequently post routine surgery and the staff could not be more helpful. Always a cheery voice on the phone and questions never go unanswered. A really great service

title: A&E
body:
I had occasion to visit A&E recently. I was treated very kindly and thoroughly by both doctors and nurses. Of course I had to wait for blood results but it was a pleasure to watch how efficiently the system was run with no lack of care to us all. It’s a big thank you from me for both my care and witnessing the kind and attentive care to others. It brought a tear to my eye as it does now writing this. X

It was

readBy.name: Healthwatch Sheffield
Sheffield Teaching Hospitals NHS Foundation Trust

author: Decde74
authorRole: a staff member posting for a carer/relative
title: The staff have all been lovely
body:
We arrived here on Monday morning via a GP referral. We initially had arrived last Friday to the emergency department, but were sent home following advice from the doctor. As my son’s condition worsened the GP referred us to the Blossom ward.  
The staff have all been lovely and treat us very kindly and make sure to deal with any problems. The doctor gives us an excellent debrief every morning and provides us with great information regarding the care. We are very comfortable and couldn’t wish for much more.

readBy.name: Southern Health and Social Care Trust

author: Decde74
authorRole: a staff member posting for a patient/service user
title: The staff have all been great
body: My child and I arrived on Sunday morning via the emergency department. We were seen to straight away. The staff have all been great with us and have been providing excellent care. We have been given good updates regarding the care which we are very appreciative of. The food has been great and we have been given a decent variety to choose from. We are also very comfortable and we have become less anxious regarding the whole situation.

readBy.name: Southern Health and Social Care Trust

author: Decde74
authorRole: a staff member posting for a carer/relative
title: The staff have been very good with us
body: My daughter and I arrived here on Monday through the gynae department. We were seen to straight away with no hesitation. The staff have been very good with us and provided excellent treatment. They provide great feedback regarding my daughter’s condition. We are very comfortable here but my daughter is getting quite bored. We do understand it is not a 5 star hotel. All in all the stay has been great so far with everything being done to a high standard.

readBy.name: Southern Health and Social Care Trust
